column4: Hey guys, I am new to linux and ubuntu (first time user) and I just installed ubuntu jaunty 2 days ago. I was wondering do I need to install any drivers for my video card?
Usually you can keep the default, but it's better to install the proprietary drivers. that can be install using the Restricted Driver Manager
how do i get to the restricted driver manager?
System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers
than you need to activate the drivers (if disable). What is your Card ?
I was already snooping around in there but there doesnt seem to be anything to install (see screenshot): http://img4.imageshack.us/img4/8937/screenshothardwaredrive.png
I know I keep buggin people about this problem, but I'm about to do a heartbreak. Is there any decent solution for people having ATI card not supported by fglrx ?
What is your card ??
ATi Radeon 9800 pro
agp
Ok, ADM/ATI doesn't support this card any more with there propreitery drivers. The solution is to stay with your current setup : keep the open source driver.
Is ther performance is decent ?

Desktop performance is fine but I am trying to play Counter Strike Source (I wanna see if i can get i running on my linux machine) and I keep crashing and I think it is because of the video drivers. I didnt install any drivers at all though, they come pre-installed
Like the game crashes when i try to join a server I cant even join. And when i load the game via Steam on Wine it says somethign about out of date drivers
At this time, with Jaunty you can forget it. Since the only driver for ATI card is the open source one, the performance in 3D is really bad ..
We are a bunch of people in the same situation (Including me)
Do you think going to an earlier version of ubuntu say 8.0ish would help?
wep, cause the propreitery driver gonna work. And I suggest you to install 8.04 as it's a LongTermSupport release (it's more stable)
chrones:If you plan is to do some gaming I guess it's a good choice to try Hardy 8.04 until we get a decent open source driver for 3D
Cool, thanks for the help
it's pleasure, and have fun trying Hardy ! :)
